messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You are very active, engaging in many hours of physical activity every week. You are someone who I agree with my thinking style. I am unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings rarely. I neutral that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I agree that my well-being is good. I strongly agree that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I neutral that I am emotionally stable and calm. I unknown that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I feel i have the capability to understand basic health information and services. I am very comfortable with understanding basic medical terms.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
i feel my dr has my best interest at heart. Everything is always explained to me. I feel as if my dr really cares about my well being.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Not knowing what the tests are going to show. Worrying the dr will find something wrong. Dr visit in general make me anxious.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
During my pregnancies, i learned a lot about my body. It has opened my eyes to my health and being healthy.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I have no problem understanding information explained to me by any healthcare staff, concerning my health.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
It appears they are more concerned about what they think is convenient for them. I wish to be in control of what is best for me.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Nothing in particular causes these feelings. I just do not care for going to a doctor. It's a sense of waiting I dislike.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I worked in the medical field many years ago. Things may not be quite accurate. Medical technology is more advance.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel like I understand most of what they are saying but sometimes the terminology they use or their writing is not able to be understood by most people including myself.  They sometimes need clarification.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I do not have complete trust in my physician because sometimes they are just out for money and do not tell you everything.  They try to push medications and not everything requires prescription medicine.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I do not like to visit the doctor because even when there is nothing wrong they try to medicate you to death.  It seems like they are just looking for a reason to give you all kinds of medicine that is not really needed.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My grandmother was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and I learned a lot from spending time in the hospital and hospice with her.  I would ask the doctors what things meant in her chart so I had a better understanding of what they were doing,

I have no problem understanding what I deal with health-wise.  I am a very healthy person, and although I am a colon cancer survivor, I now have no medical issues.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
He is a very caring person, who takes the time to really talk to and bond with his patients.  I am lucky to have found him.  We are short on physicians here in Hawaii.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am always concerned about cancer.  I am a colon cancer survivor and always worry that it could become a problem once again for me.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I keep fairly on top of things medical wise.  I have never been in a hospital, with the exception fo when I was born, being for the most part a very healthy person.

I THINK I CAN UNDERSTAND PRETTY WELL, AT LEAST WHAT PILLS IM TAKING, WHEN AND HOW MANY. WHEN I HAD CANCER I HAD TO HAVE THINGS EXPLAINED TO ME ABOUT TREATMENTS ETC.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
HE SEEMS TO CARE ABOUT  ME, IS ALWAYS FRIENDLY AND NOT IN A RUSH TO GET IT OVER WITH. NOT AFAID TO TELL ME I SHOULD LOST WEIGHT AND STOP EATING CERTAIN THINGS
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
ALWAYS AFAIRD SOMETHING IS WRONG WHEN I HAVE TESTS, ALWAYS ANXIOUS WHAT THE SCALE WILL SAY.  BUT IN THE END IM ALWAYS FEEL BETTER WHEN I LEAVE AND HAVE MY ANSWERS
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
MY LAST OPERATION, SIMPLE KNEE REPLACEMENT SURGRY, DUE TO POOR DOCTORING I WAS IN FOR 14 DAYS WITH KNEE, STOMACH BLEEDING, PNEUOMIA AND KIDNEY FAILFURE.  TOO MANY DOCTORS GIVING ME DIFFERENT THINGS.

I feel like sometimes it is hard to understand the information and services about health care. I do think I can figure it out though. There are many resources available to help with things like that these days.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
For the most part, I think doctors are trustworthy. However, they are very busy and see a lot of patients, so they could make mistakes, just like everyone else.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
Wondering what the outcome of my exam would be. Imagining if there is something wrong and what needs to happen next.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I've had a baby, and my wife has been in and out of the hospital the past 2 years for a few surgeries. My sister is also a nurse, and has talked with me about a lot of medical and health issues.

I think that I always feel the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my primary care physician because he is extremely careful and honest telling me about all the different treatment options all the time.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
What makes me feel most anxious or worried when I visit the doctor's office is think if I'm going to feel any pain or any discomfort.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My experience in life that demonstrated my knowledge of health or medical issues was the last year when I had to help a old lady in the street.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I have a good general knowledge of medical procedures, medications and facts.  However, there are occasionally topics that I'm sure I know something about that I'm wrong on.  Because of this, when I'm interacting with my doctors, nurses and pharmacists I will clarify by repeating what they said to me to make sure. If I'm unsure I'll ask for more information. If I'm not at the office or pharmacy and I'm unsure about info I've called the doctor's office (or pharmacy) and asked for clarification.  Just last week I called the nurse online to help me decide whether or not to take my son to urgent care.  It was very helpful.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor wholeheartedly.  He is very concerned about my well being and has been very thorough in helping me solve my problems. He isn't afraid to deal with my insurance company head on to get me the best care.  He hasn't let me down in the past and won't do it in the future.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I always know there will be a conversation about my weight.  What makes me most anxious though is my blood pressure.  It always reacts when I'm in the doctor's office.  I've tried breathing exercises, visualization, hydrating well and distraction.  They work to a certain extent in calming me down but aren't 100% successful.  It's so annoying!  (My blood pressure is fine everywhere else but the office).  They know me well enough that they take an initial pressure and come back 10 minutes later after I've relaxed.  Totally a psychological response.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

The flu hit my family last week.  We had our flu shots so our fevers weren't extremely high (less than 101).  The accompanying symptoms were severe fatigue, cough, nausea and an extreme sore throat.  I was concerned because in the past my children have had atypical symptoms for strep throat (pain, nausea but no fever). However, I knew that a cough wasn't typical either.  I watched my son's throat for a few days and there weren't any unusual signs until last Thursday night when white spots started showing up.  At that point, my usual wait and see on a fever and cough symptoms turned into a doctor's appointment.  I've learned to wait out viruses but not to mess with what could be a possible strep.  Thankfully it wasn't strep but I knew what to look for and be concerned from past experience.

I have minor problems with the bills only. I understand my doctors orders and the importantance of taking all medication on and every day.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my primary care doctor completely because of my time with her. She has gotten my hip replacement done for me.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
This question is not for me. I look forward to going to the doctor's office. There is no problem that makes me feel bad.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I woke one morning feeling odd. There was no reason for this. As i started figuring this out, i came up with chemical imbalance in my head. Doctor agreed.

I feel very comfortable contacting my doctor on the phone or via email and asking questions.  I do not have any problem interacting with with the medical staff and processing the information provided.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor presents me with options when it comes to my health. He is always available to me.  I can reach him on the phone or via email.  He responds promptly to my requests
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am anxious more than worried because I have high blood pressure and high cholesterol.  I am always anxious while waiting for the blood results
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
a couple of years ago, I felt my some numbness in my fingers and tongue.  I searched online, suspecting a stroke.  I called my doctor who confirms my suspicions and I was ruched to the ER.

I feel that while I am not a health expert I do have the ability to listen to what the doctors say and I can understand what I am told so that I am able to understand what I am being told by them.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I like that the dr takes the time to listen and make sure to understand what is going on and to make me feel like a person that can get better and do well.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I do not like to wait for test results to say what is going on with my overall health I like to know right away what is happening and going on .
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I tried to use my math skills the best that I felt that I could to try and figure out the information presented.

I feel very confident in my ability to read and understand the paperwork regarding my medical conditions.  I am also confident in my ability to understand basic health information and I am not afraid to ask questions regarding my care.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because he is not too quick to prescribe drugs.  If there is a natural approach to fix the problem he will give safe suggestions to try before encouraging a drug fix to the problem.  And what he has suggested has worked for the most part.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am just funny about people touching me so I get anxious about that.  Also that something might be found that I don't want to find out about.  Just the whole process of having to be examined.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I go for sinus infections and bronchitis.  I always know that is what it is.  And I'm right most of the time.  I already know what treatments will be given.  I usually know how long it will take for the meds to kick in.

I feel perfectly capable to fill out forms and take care of the circumstance that may arise. The information I do not understand sometimes is the medical terms of diseases and lab work.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
If I can not trust my doctor I am in big trouble.  Most of the time he is correct and only has our best interest at heart.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
If I am in a doctors office I have a serious problem so therefore I am going to be anxious to know what my problem is and how serious it is.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My husband is terminally ill with multiple myleoma, my father had pancreatic cancer, my husband has diabetes, has had three bi-passes and one valve replaced in his heart, gout and my mother had liver cancer and my father also had hodgskins disease.  My mother worked as a nurses' aid in a hospital for twenty years and I basically grew up there.

I feel that I have the ability to understand health information if explained in a clear and concise manner by a nurse or doctor. As a college educated individual, I have the capacity to process the information explained to me and understand more by doing individual research.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor has my best interests in mind at all times. She will take the time to explain my health to me in order for me to understand and go thru many options when treatment arises. She is always patient and listens when I have questions or am worried about my health.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I am worried that my doctor will discover a health issue and not be able to adequately explain the cause or offer treatment solutions.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I went to the doctor for issues with a stress fracture in my leg. This had been a reoccurring issue in my life, and I was able to understand what the doctor was describing as far as the impacts on my leg.

I am capable of obtaining, processing, and understanding basic health information and services to make appropriate health decisions. I have a doctoral degree in pharmacy.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care doctor because he will refer me to a specialist if he is unaware of anything. I trust my ob gyn because he is knowledgeable, easy to talk to, respectful, he listens, he gives me options. Both my physicians listen and do research.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I am worried when I visit the doctor's office because I have numerous health issues. I'm usually afraid that something will be wrong. I feel better after speaking with my doctors regardless of the outcome of my exam, labs, etc.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I'm a hospital pharmacist with a doctoral degree. Although I'm in management, I precept students and I train Pharmacists in clinical areas such as kinetics, antimicrobial stewardship, etc.

I feel sometimes i do not ask questions and wish I had. Normally I understand the information I am told by doctors and nurses.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I just havent had the best physicians. Ive been wrongly diagnosed in the past so there is little trust when it comes to doctors.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I expect bad news. Usually i go to doctors when something is wrong so im on edge anyway.

Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

several years ago, I had a friend whose doctor told her she should have a hysterectomy because she had fibroids.  when she called me she was crying because she wanted children and would no longer be able to have any if she had the surgery. I advised her to get a second and even a third opinion because there were alternatives. She did and found a Doctor who was able to successfully remove her fibroids without doing a Hysterectomy and she now have 2 beautiful children!

My primary care person is a local Nurse Practitioner.  She is busy but never seems rushed while visiting with me about my concerns.  She listens and then asks questions to be sure she understands. I like that she doesn't talk down to me and treats me as though I am intelligent enough to understand.

Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My husband's cholesterol is high.  We talked to the doctor and then looked up information to see what target number we needed to get him to.  Then we researched on our own and followed information the doctor gave us to determine the changes we could make in our diet and exercise program to help bring his cholesterol down.  We were able to facilitate that change enough in 6 months to avoid needing to have him take medication.

I don't want to feel anxious, but there is something about me that is turally anxious. I know this about myself because my BP reading inflates every time I go for a checkup.  I feel I am this way even in social situations although no one takes my BP under those circumstances.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

When I was 37 years old, I discovered a flat but palpable tumor under my  left breast. It was found to be "hot" and otherwise suspicious, plus I had other small spots show up in the mammogram in my right breast. Biopsies were done and no cancer found, but the surgeon, at the time, recommended bilateral, subcutaneous mastectomies. After talking with my husband, my PCP, and others, plus doing a lot of research, I filly decided to go ahead. One year later, I was referred to a reconstructive surgeon who placed silicone implants under both breast flaps.  I still have those same implants and I'm now 81. I've had no problems with them. Of course, the various doctors get the credit for good work and incredible support for me, but I also take credit for studying the issue and making a hard decision that I feel helped keep me safe from cancer all these years.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care physician because I have always gotten a working solution for my problems. She also provides me with all the information I need to know about my different diagnosis.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I get worried and anxious when I'm not sure if my problems will require some kind of procedure or if I will get a diagnosis I don't want to hear (like having cancer). The doctor herself doesn't make me feel uncomfortable or nervous, it is the consequences related to my problems that make we worried.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A few years ago, I had a pain in my lower stomach that I thought was a bladder infection. I went to get it checked out and found out that it wasn't a bladder infection. I did some research online to see what other things could be causing my pain. One of them was ovarian cysts. I went to a gynecologist and she confirmed that I had cysts.
